intro: Orobus tuberosus, commonly known as the tuberous orobus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It features a fibrous root system with swollen, starchy tubers that are often harvested for culinary use. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale purple flowers. Its tubers are rich in carbohydrates and have a slightly sweet, nutty flavor. Orobus tuberosus is often found in moist, well-drained soils in temperate to subtropical regions.
